text: Pepel is a coastal town in the Port Loko District in the Northern Province of Sierra Leone. == Port == Pepel has a port in the Sierra Leone River used for shipping bulk iron ore via the mining company African Minerals. == Railway == Pepel is connected by a gauge 84 km long railway to an iron ore mine at Marampa. It is proposed to introduce a more efficient balloon loop at the port.Map - scroll down to view balloon loop. An extension of this line to a deeper port at Tagrin Point is also proposed. == See also == * Railway stations in Sierra Leone * Transport in Sierra Leone == References == Category:Populated places in Sierra Leone Category:Western Area
